TopicTitle: PLEASE fix the deep space disassembly bug!

Articles.Content: I cannot conduct ANY interplanetry travel ATM due to this stupid bug which always causes structural failures even in HEAVILY STRUTTED rockets after long periods of high time accelleration which are REQUIRED in order to travel between planets. I HATE BEING STUCK TO THE AREA AROUND KERBIN! FIX. THIS. BUG!
There is a temporary fix for this bug, instead of going straight down to 1x from the highest warp, gradually step down with the < key and that will preserve your ship.
Quiet you, a fix is coming in 0.17.1

Quiet you, a fix is coming in 0.17.1

That's good to know but I agree with you that doggie015 was being a bit bad tempered when he "asked".

Quiet you, a fix is coming in 0.17.1

Are the planets being removed? that will fix the problem.

I still haven't encountered this bug myself, do those who are victim of this spam the warp-down key or something?

And doggie015, the use of caps and the demanding tone are not useful to fix bugs. This is known and as Nova said, will be fixed. If you don't remember, there have been experimental releases, during which lots of other bugs (including game-breaking ones) were fixed, so you could be thankful instead of ranting.

Thanks for understanding, and remember everyone is playing the same game, with the same bugs.

Here is HarvesteR discussing the issue and the fix: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/20917-0-17-Space-Cuthulu-Dropping-from-max-warp-to-no-warp-makes-your-ship-explode?p=279910&viewfull=1#post279910

So it's coming in 17.1, but I'm sure they want to fix other bugs or something.

I cannot conduct ANY interplanetry travel ATM due to this stupid bug which always causes structural failures even in HEAVILY STRUTTED rockets after long periods of high time accelleration which are REQUIRED in order to travel between planets. I HATE BEING STUCK TO THE AREA AROUND KERBIN! FIX. THIS. BUG!

Like others have already mentioned, a fix is forthcoming. However, the latest version of MechJeb already adjusts for it, so until 0.17.1 is released with a formal fix, try installing the newest version of MechJeb and flying on autopilot for a few days or weeks. Or be gentle with the warp keys, which works, but is tricky. Always remember, be patient, this is alpha software.

Like others have already mentioned, a fix is forthcoming. However, the latest version of MechJeb already adjusts for it, so until 0.17.1 is released with a formal fix, try installing the newest version of MechJeb and flying on autopilot for a few days or weeks. Or be gentle with the warp keys, which works, but is tricky. Always remember, be patient, this is alpha software.

Emphasis added. -.-

I dare say that KSP is doing pretty awesome for its state of development. We're lucky to be able to play it now, help with bugs, and get it for a lower price than it will be too.
Or have a way of detecting if the kraken is coming, and spawn a kraken model that attacks your ship.
A fix for this wouldn't even be needed if people didn't mash the warp button.

I don't mash any button, but I get it by clicking on the 1X triangle button.

Plus, a bug is a bug, regardeless of the way you get it.

It's not like if it was something like "get on 1000X warp, hold Ctrl+Alt+J and press M and your ship will go boom" it's a simple thing people do everytime.

Only impatient people do that. The rest of us safely use smooth dewarping with the warp keys to avoid this entirely.

Yes, it's a bug, and if you'd keep up with current events, Harv's solved it and the fix will be included in the 0.17.1 revision update.

Only impatient people do that. The rest of us safely use smooth dewarping with the warp keys to avoid this entirely.

Yes, it's a bug, and if you'd keep up with current events, Harv's solved it and the fix will be included in the 0.17.1 revision update.

Some of us didn't even know about the warp keys before the advent of physical time warp and so always used the arrow

That being said, I have never encountered this bug as I now always use the keys. Mouse is overrated.

Wait, you guys are saying you can click the arrows to change warp speed? I honestly didn't know that...makes sense I guess.

Clearly a habit of mine from my early gamer years to not assume anything with respond to mouse clicks.

I simply can't use the commands, and I didn't know there was commands for it, as I have a Windows keyboard plugged to my MacIntosh computer, and with French layout. I can't use the defaults key because I need to press Maj, and it doesn't work.

And I'm used to click on the arrows. I'm not impatient, it's just that why I would click on all the arrows when I can click on the first one?
If that's the case, click all the arrows and de-warp slowly until 0.17.1.

Well slowing down to 5X then 1X does the trick, but thanks you.

I just meant that if I use the graphical interface, there is no point to click on every arrows when you want to slow down, you just click on 1X Except in this case of Space Kraken.
